data.title: Viacom launching Nick and NickJr Channels on PlutoTV on May 1st
data.meta_description:
Viacom, Pluto TV Partner on Co-branded MTV, Comedy Central, and Nickelodeon Channels - WrapPRO 


Nick Pluto TV: Welcome to Nick Pluto TV where you can...
data.text:
SG-17

Well-Known Member

Joined

May 12, 2018

Messages

510

Location

Pennsylvania

Apr 29, 2019

#1

Viacom, Pluto TV Partner on Co-branded MTV, Comedy Central, and Nickelodeon Channels - WrapPRO

Nick Pluto TV: Welcome to Nick Pluto TV where you can watch your favorite classic shows from “All That,” “Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles,” “The Fairly Odd Parents,” “iCarly” and more! It’s all on Nick Pluto TV.

Nick Jr. Pluto TV: Welcome to Nick Jr. Pluto TV where you’ll find your preschooler’s favorite friends from classic “Blue’s Clues,” “Dora the Explorer,” “Wallykazam” and many more hit Nick Jr. Pluto TV shows.

I thought this was interesting. I don't use PlutoTV much so I wonder how this will work out in the long run.

ShayL

Member

Joined

Jun 3, 2016

Messages

43

Location

Philadelphia

Apr 29, 2019

#2

Interesting. I'm not really a fan of MTV and I don't use PlutoTV that much either. In fact I forgot I still had the App installed on my Amazon Firestick. I'd be curious to see what ends up being on the Nickelodeon channel other than the shows named.

I'd also be curious to see if the Comedy Central channel might show Dr. Katz Professional Therapist. (and I imagine South Park? Even though it's still on the air now.) My mom has seen Dr. Katz before so I always knew about it. I was young when Dr. Katz came out so never had a chance to watch it. I remember the parody from the South Park episode "Summer Sucks." I also remember the Dr. Katz parody from the Arthur episode "The Contest." I may have to check this out when it launches.

#3

From what I understand channels on PlutoTV are linear channels like you'd find on cable. So I wonder what kind of schedule we will see with these Nick channels? I guess we will find out tomorrow.

#4

This get me so excited. I already have Pluto TV, and I very much like what it has to offer so far.

Since Viacom bought the service, I expected (and hoped) the company to add a deluge of content from its networks on the service; and what do ya know, my expectations were exceeded.

I can't wait to check out these channels and get acquainted real quick.

Based on what I've read from related news articles, and Nick's replies on Twitter, here's what we know will be on Nick's Pluto channel so far.

All That

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (probably the 2012 one)

Fairly OddParents

iCarly

Are You Afraid of the Dark?

Rugrats

Doug

True Jackson VP

Clarissa Explains it All

Rocko's Modern Life

Double Dare (the original series)

Kenan and Kel

SpongeBob SquarePants
